alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... But each new young physicist ... is in danger of forgetting all the past rumination and present uncertainty, and of starting with an uncritical acceptance of the concepts in the stage of development in which he finds them."

- Percy W. Bridgman (1961), Nobel Laureate in Physics (1946)
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The Progress of Physics is Unsystematic - Part 2
